author: andschwa
body:
We need to determine what needs to be tested and automated. I think we can start by taking care of all the issues [labeled test](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Atest).

When those are done, we can move on to automating full PowerShell on Linux end-to-end testing.

Note that we also have the Windows PowerShell tests, that are in the process of being ported. @vors can you add any relevant information for that here?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @JumpingYang001 We can use this issue to track what your team should do. I don't see any problem starting with adding the missing Pester test cases that we already have tracked.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: @JumpingYang001 can you elaborate what are the missing Pester tests?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
The missing Pester tests make up about ten of the issues labeled `test`. They're just backlog items that have been filed.

@JamesWTruher We'd also like to know what's being ported from the Windows side, I know there is ongoing work there.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Addressing all [BVT/DRT](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/labels/BVT%2FDRT) regressions should be included

comments.author: JumpingYang001
comments.body: @andschwa Got it, I have sent Email to Steve and CC to you with title "PSL Linux Testing", thanks.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @JumpingYang001 Cool. I've assigned this to Steve, mostly just so he can find it more easily. I know @FawcettJohnW wanted to give some input on what to do as well. Relevant discussions/decisions ought to take place here so we can track it all :notebook:
